title: Separate different viral genome sizes
original description: For use in "Fingerprinting aquatic virus communities using PFGE"
steps:
None
1. (1) 1–5 s switch time with 20 h run time for separation of small genome sizes (0–130 kb). 
72000s
2. (2) 8–30 s switch time with 20 h run time for separation of medium genome sizes (130–300 kb). 
72000s
3. (3) 20–40 s switch time with 22 h run time for separation of large genome sizes (300–600 kb). 
79200s
4. Stain the gel for 30 min or overnight in fluorescent stain (according to manufacturer’s instructions) and view on a UV transilluminator. 
1800s
ai_generated_description: This molecular biology protocol outlines the steps to separate different sizes of viral genomes, which can be integral in the process of fingerprinting aquatic virus communities using Pulse Field Gel Electrophoresis (PFGE). The protocol gives instructions for separating small, medium, and large genome sizes followed by staining for visual identification.
